labels.text: On a daily basis, Lu Qing painstakingly painted tiny squares on a silk roll over forty metres long. The black and grey paint traces her technique and repetitious process over multiple years, which for her served as a form of meditation and discipline. The minute changes in the shade of each square reflects the pressure the artist applied, as well as her emotional state, during a precise moment in time. Lu is one of the few female painters in China to work with abstraction. She is best known for her conceptual approach to exploring traditional calligraphy, the long duration required for the production of her works, and her emphasis on process over the final result.

路青每天都在這幅超過40米長的絹軸上繪畫無數小方格，日復日直至完成。她採用黑和灰的色調，以精細的技巧重複這個被稱為「爬格子」的繪畫步驟，創作長達數年，顯示出藝術家的紀律和冥想般的創作形式。每個格子在色澤深淺的微細區別，表現出她在每一瞬間所應用的力度，以至情感狀態的不同。路青是中國少數抽象女畫家，其對中國書法的概念性詮釋、每件作品的長時間創作，以及「過程重於結果」的藝術理念，都成為了她的風格標記。

images.AltText: Ink painting on silk. A forty-meter-long bolt of silk is covered with thousands of rows of distinct monochrome squares. The work is presented with a section of the silk roll draped across two wooden tables standing far away from each other.
images.AltTextTC: 水墨絹本畫作。一捲40米長的絲絹上，佈滿數千行填上水墨的方格，每一格的墨色稍有不同。絹軸橫跨兩張相距甚遠的木桌子展示，作品的其中一部分在桌子間微微墜下。
